entity.name: writerp
entity.comment: A protocol designed for classes whose instantiations can write to file and create objects.

predicate.name: write_entity/1
predicate.comment: Writes a flat version of the entity to file.

argument.name: identifier
argument.description: used together with the .lgt ending to form the file name and as the name of the object written into the file.

remark.text: Designed to be implemented by classes associated with the protocols for the main types of entity, such as plp or plp_ds, although it can also be meaningfully overwritten by individual implementations. This predicate writes a flat version of the entity to file, with facts for all the predicates declared in the associated protocol.

predicate.name: create_entity/1
predicate.comment: Creates a flat version of the entitic as a dynamic object.

argument.name: identifier
argument.description: used as the name of the object written into the file.

remark.text: Designed to be implemented by classes associated with the protocols for the main types of entity, such as plp or plp_ds, although it can also be meaningfully overwritten by individual implementations. This predicate creates a flat version of the entity as a dynamic object, with facts for all the predicates declared in the associated protocol.
